title: Exploring the Use of Electron Rutherford Backscattering for the Detection and Quantification of Light Elements in Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM)
content: Elastically backscattered electrons suffer a small loss of their kinetic energy to the interacting atom. The interaction is electrostatic and is described as a Rutherford backscattering process. The elastic peak is a strong signal of the secondary electron distribution and allows the measurement of recoil losses at low primary beam current in the nA range. Correspondingly, a high spatial resolution can be achieved in a SEM. The measurement of the recoil energy loss requires a high energy resolution analyzer to measure the elastic peak position and shape. The compact energy analyzer used is described in [2,3].
